which a most extraordinary function is 
assigned. The peculiar gregariniform 
body thus produced is described as making 
its way from the interior of the muscular 
fasciculus into the cellular interspaces between 
the fibres, where, losing its ciliary or setose 
armature it becomes vesicular & is 
gradually transformed into a cysticercus.

explanation of the nature of the appearances 
described I would remark that the 
granular appearance noticed as indicative of the 
first origin of the future Cysticercus, bears,
as the author himself <s>remarks <\s> states a very 
close resemblance to <s>those <\s> what is observed in 
incipient degeneration of the muscular
